newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH GOVT FINANCES IN BETTER SHAPE - AGENCY.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH GOVT FINANCES IN BETTER SHAPE - AGENCY.

text.p: Dutch Prime Minister Wim Kok said on Friday the government had an extra four billion guilders which it could use to lower taxes, social security contributions and the budget deficit in 1998, Dutch news agency ANP reported.
Kok was speaking after the first cabinet meeting since the summer break. The meeting focused on the 1998 budget which will be presented to parliament on September 16.

Official figures have consistently shown the Netherlands' meeting the EMU deficit target of three percent of GDP and revenue figures have frequently been revised upwards as the Dutch economy continues to perform strongly.
